qas.question: Who overturned the Taft Vale judgement?
Who was elected Chairman of the Parliamentary Labour Party?
How many votes did Keir Hardie win by?
What name did the group adopt during their last meeting?
What name did the group adopt before 1906?
Who had not helped the party to become established?
What provided the party's activist base in the party's later years?
What was one of the last acts of the new Liberal Government?

context: In their first meeting after the election the group's Members of Parliament decided to adopt the name "<b4_0><b5_0>The Labour Party<b5_0/><b4_0/>" formally (15 February 1906). <a1_0><b6_0>Keir Hardie<b6_0/><a1_0/>, who had taken a leading role in getting the party established, was elected as Chairman of the Parliamentary Labour Party (in effect, the Leader), although only by <a2_0>one vote<a2_0/> over <a3_0>David Shackleton<a3_0/> after several ballots. In the party's early years the <b7_0>Independent Labour Party<b7_0/> (ILP) provided much of its activist base as the party did not have individual membership until 1918 but operated as a conglomerate of affiliated bodies. The Fabian Society provided much of the intellectual stimulus for the party. One of the first acts of the new <a0_0>Liberal Government<a0_0/> was to <b8_0>reverse the Taff Vale judgement<b8_0/>.
